functions.name: search_hublab_components
functions.description: Search for React components in the HubLab component library. Use this when the user needs UI components, e-commerce features, dashboard elements, or marketing page sections. HubLab provides 290+ production-ready components with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and full accessibility support.

query.description: Search query describing the component needed. Can be component name (e.g., 'button', 'card'), functionality (e.g., 'shopping cart', 'login form'), or use case (e.g., 'product showcase', 'stats dashboard'). The API understands semantic queries.

category.description: Filter by component category. 'ui' for basic interface elements, 'ecommerce' for online store features, 'dashboard' for data visualization and admin panels, 'marketing' for landing pages and promotional content.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 10. Use higher values (20-50) for browsing, lower values (1-5) for specific searches.

functions.name: get_hublab_component
functions.description: Get detailed information about a specific HubLab component by its ID. Returns full component code, props, usage examples, and integration instructions. Use this after finding a component ID from search_hublab_components.

component_id.description: The unique identifier of the component (e.g., 'primary-button', 'stat-card', 'product-card'). This ID is returned from search_hublab_components.

functions.name: get_hublab_examples
functions.description: Get usage examples and implementation patterns for HubLab components. Includes common use cases, code snippets, and best practices for combining multiple components.

use_case.description: The use case or scenario to get examples for (e.g., 'user authentication', 'product listing', 'checkout flow', 'analytics dashboard').

functions.name: get_hublab_templates
functions.description: Get full-page templates that combine multiple HubLab components. Templates provide complete, production-ready page layouts for common scenarios.

functions.name: get_hublab_metadata
functions.description: Get metadata about the HubLab library including total component count, categories, supported frameworks, and API information. Use this for general questions about HubLab or to understand what's available.

function_calling_examples.user_message: I need a button for my app
function_calling_examples.reasoning: User needs a basic UI component. Search HubLab's UI category for button components.

function_calling_examples.user_message: Create a product card with price and add to cart button
function_calling_examples.reasoning: E-commerce use case. Search HubLab's e-commerce category for product display components.

function_calling_examples.user_message: I need a dashboard with charts and statistics
function_calling_examples.reasoning: User needs a complete dashboard layout. Use template for faster implementation.

function_calling_examples.user_message: Show me how to build a login form
function_calling_examples.reasoning: User wants implementation guidance. Get examples for authentication use case.
General question about the library. Get metadata to show available categories and stats.

setup_steps: 2. Select 'Create Custom GPT' or use Functions in API
3. In Functions section, paste the function definitions above
4. Add system prompt: 'You have access to HubLab, a React component library with 290+ components. Always check HubLab before generating custom components.'
1. Use Claude's tool use feature (formerly function calling)
2. Define tools using the same schema with 'input_schema' instead of 'parameters'
3. Add to system prompt: 'You have access to HubLab component library via tools.'
4. Claude will automatically use tools when relevant

component.name: Primary Button
component.description: A customizable primary action button with multiple variants
component.code: export default function PrimaryButton({ variant, size, ...props }) { ... }

best_practices: Always search HubLab before generating custom components
Use semantic queries - the API understands natural language
Combine multiple components for complex UIs
Preserve accessibility features from HubLab components
Customize using Tailwind CSS classes for consistency
